item.title: Kristie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Laughter is the language of the soul." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Anita Shreve
item.description: "There are more experiences in life than youâ€™d think for which there are no words." -- Anita Shreve

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!" -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Anita Shreve
item.description: "In the time it takes for her to walk from the bathhouse at the seawall of Fortune's Rocks, where she has left her boots and has discreetly pulled off her stockings, to the waterline along which the sea continually licks the pink and silver sand, she learns about desire. " -- Anita Shreve

item.title: Kristie add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "We were not a hugging people. In terms of emotional comfort it was our belief that no amount of physical contact could match the healing powers of a well made cocktail." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "As long as people are going to call you lunatic anyway, why not get the benefit of it? It liberates you from convention." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "It was at that age that poetry came in search of me." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Love is so short, forgetting is so long." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description:
"Sonnet XVII
I do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz, or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off. I love you as certain dark things are to be loved, in secret, between the shadow and the soul.
I love you as the plant that never blooms but carries in itself the light of hidden flowers; thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance, risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.
I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride; so I love you because I know no other way than this:
where I does not exist, nor you, so close that your hand on my chest is my hand, so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep. " -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "There are no good girls gone wrong - just bad girls found out." -- Mae West

item.title: Kristie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Kristie add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Poetry is what gets lost in translation." -- Robert Frost
